instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .
definitions.PP0V9_SSD: What is PP0V9_SSD? PP0V9_SSD is a power rail that powers the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on Macbooks with soldered on storage and must be present for the SSD to show up. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: i have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, T2 get hot.  USB C 5V 0.14Amp

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Tried DFU?
If not recognized, check if all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
The Diode reading for <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is 0.060v. when i remove 3 of 4 usb c chip it goes to 0.320v. 
Is this line shorted ?
Voltage reading 0b

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Did you check diode mode after each chip removed?
I suppose only one was bad...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Yes, finally I found a short on CD32 chip and i replaced it. All chips are good now, but i unfortunately i reballed the T2 chip with the upper side, Without any need.
Now i have 5v0 and 0.2amps and after 10 sec it drops to 0 amps.

All voltage are good on the sequence diagram until ssd voltage.
<SIGNAL>SSD_PMU_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 1.8V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD</SIGNAL> 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Try DFU revive; let see if SSD comes on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: I can't get to DFU mode...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Should be recognizex in DFU, even no SSD voltages present.
All AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages must be present.

Check diode mode to ground on SSD power rails.
